subject: Re: Re: Ant could not create task : junit
msgSnippet: Thank you!  Success: 1) I copied junit.jar to ANT_HOME/lib 2) I simplified the junit (init-test) task:
messageBody:
Thank you! Success:

1) I copied junit.jar to ANT_HOME/lib
2) I simplified the junit (init-test) task:
<target name="unit-test" depends="test-var">
<junit printsummary="true" haltonfailure="true" >
<classpath>
<pathelement location="${JUNIT_HOME}/junit.jar" />
<pathelement location="${ANT_HOME}/lib/ant-junit.jar" />
<pathelement path="build/classes" />
<pathelement path="test/classes" />
</classpath>
<batchtest fork="yes" >
<formatter type="plain" usefile="false" />
<fileset dir="test/classes">
<include name="AllTests.class" />
<include name="SimpleFractionTest.class" />
</fileset>
</batchtest>
</junit>
<echo>junit-run complete!</echo>
</target>

Those two steps let ANT run from the command line.

Several more steps let ANT run from within Eclipse.

Again, thank you.

Clark Anderson
